Following the 19U9 Seminar, a request was submitted to the W* K,
Kellogg Foundation for finds to establish a national educational tape
network and a national headquarters for the NASS, with a paid permanent
staff* It was with the granting of these requested funds that what had
previously been only a dream began to becoms reality*
Within four years of the first grant, the NAEB Radio Network was
self-supporting* The NAEB Headquarters, made possible by this grant, gave
the NAEB the mechanism which made possible the business-like administration
of other grant funds in the slew but steady climb of the association
towards status as a respected service organization in educational broad¬
casting and the still slower progress towards achievement of the related
role as the professional association of those responsible, as management
and staff members, for the operation of educational radio and television
facilities throughout the nation*
